snippet: President Mohamed Morsi vowed to proceed with a vote on an Islamist-backed constitution that has set off deadly battles between his supporters and opponents.
abstract: Pres Mohamed Morsi of Egypt blames latest outbreak of violence on 'fifth column' and vows to proceed with vote on Islamist-backed constitution that has set off deadly battles between his supporters and secular opponents; opponents openly reject Morsi's televised speech and call for new protests.

byline.contributor: Two employees of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi vowed to proceed with a vote on an Islamist-backed constitution that has set off deadly battles between his supporters and opponents.

headline.seo: Morsi Defends Wide Authority in Egypt as Turmoil Rises
headline.main: Morsi Defends Wide Authority as Turmoil Rises in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Morsi Defends Wide Authority As Turmoil Rises

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
